meanings.definition: Used to indicate that the same thing as previously mentioned applies again.
meanings.sent1: She said she liked the movie, and I said ditto.
meanings.sent2: When he mentioned his favorite color, I replied with ditto.
meanings.sent3: After hearing her order, he jokingly said ditto to the waiter.
meanings.sent4: His actions were a ditto of what he had done the day before.
meanings.sent5: The echo in the cave was like a ditto of his words.

meanings.sent1: She made a ditto of the key for her sister.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a ditto of the original painting.
meanings.sent3: He kept a ditto of the important document in a safe place.
meanings.sent4: The copy machine produced a perfect ditto of the report.
meanings.sent5: The second cake was a ditto of the first, down to the last sprinkle.

meanings.definition: The same as stated above or before.
meanings.sent1: The instructions on the second page were a ditto of the first.
meanings.sent2: Her response was a ditto of what she had said earlier.
meanings.sent3: The recipe for the cake was a ditto from the cookbook.
meanings.sent4: The speech he gave was a ditto of the one he had practiced.
meanings.sent5: The pattern on the fabric was a ditto of the design on the wallpaper.
